overview:
Bob Leibold is an entrepreneur businessman who has owned his own company, Natural Light Productions for over 15 years.

He is a resident of Cincinnati, Ohio and has had a varied career in broadcast and cable. Bob has extensive experience in community television having worked as a trainer and programmer for Viacom Cable in Dayton, Ohio and as a Studio Manager for Time Warner Cable in Cincinnati. His broadcast experience includes managing radio stations WQRP FM and WCXL FM in Dayton also.

He is a teacher having taught video production at Southern Ohio College, the Ohio Center for Broadcasting and at a charter high school in Dayton, Ohio. For the last four years, he has taught film creation and production in Norwood, Ohio to middle school students in an After School Grant Funded project.

As a Producer-Director, Bob has directed many productions for Warner Cable and for After Midnight, a music variety show in Cincinnati. UFO Update:LIVE was another production Bob produced and directed. This project resulted in over 20 sixty minute programs which ended with the untimely death of principle researcher - panelist, Pat Packard.

Bob is working on his fourth screenplay, Bottomfeeder, or as he calls it “Jaws in the Ohio.”
